description:
I go to three places after work for a drink, Steff's, Pink Elephant and John Collins. All have their own specialities. 

Steff's is my favorite when I want to go with one or two coworkers as there is usually room at the bar or a table. The drinks are reasonable with specials as well, and every now and then they have some pretty legit local brews. It's a standard american bar and i love them for that. Not overly grime-y like some places can be but also not super nice. Just a good bar to have a few drinks with friends.
author: Jason P.

description:
This is my favorite bar in fidi. I came here for the first time 5 years ago with coworkers. I was drunk so I didnt remember much. I came here a second time a few years ago. It was then that I first laid eyes on the beautiful White Swan named Rachel. Long, graceful, beautiful like a dream mannerist painting. She had a soft smile and a pour meaner than a sailors scurvy! The bar is pretty cool too. There's a pool table in the back, and you know what? The clientele is mostly subdued white collar looking for a post-work, post-Obama sip. 

Oh yeah, it's happy hour 24/7. Nuff said
author: Johny B.

description:
College-aged kids like to come here to get shit-faced and make spectacles of themselves. Fun to watch as gals with flat bums try to be slutty sultry to many of the males in their group, as they not-so-discreetly grind on them and then act dismissive right after. Today's youth is pretty hysterical. 

Came here with my mate and had some red wine. I think they only had one bottle of Merlot since this is a place of beers and real booze. Fun times, nonetheless. Prices are very reasonable.
author: Kammie G.

description: Good place to watch a game. Ok selection of tap beers, probably could use a little boost but overall can't complain. Two giant screens on either side and a few TVs over the bar - really can't ask for much more. Note that there's no food here but they are ok with bringing in food from other places in the area like for example the burger place next door or the chicken sandwich place on New Montgomery. I hate going out for food when I'm already situated and having my drinks so next time I'll stop to pick up some food first and then head to Steff's. Sounds like a plan.
author: Gil S.

description:
Just one of the many sports bars around the area. They have a few snacks and the drinks are standard. Snacks Include, hotdogs,corn dogs,chips.. etc. I wouldn't come expecting a meal. 

The lady at the bar was extremely rude. We came to this bar looking to have a good time after we had a few drinks elsewhere. We ordered hotdogs, corn dogs, and a few shots. Our bill came to about 45 bucks and my friend decided to tip the lady about 3 bucks. She came back demanding more money. Really? Totally killed our vibe! On top of that, she forgot our chips.
author: Mehak D.

description:
She's amazing. 

On a very random night, we ended up here. 
We were welcomed with a warm, bright smile. 

Cheers, ajuma.
author: Becca I.

description: ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!! Went here on 10/8/18 to watch the Redskin Monday night game.  After asking for a beer the Asian lady behind the bar seemed a little irritated.  As she was walking away after giving me my beer I asked her to turn one of the tvs on the game and she replied VERY RUDELY that she had four customers needing service and she would get to it when she could.  She then came back and said are you going start a tab?  I said yes and gave her my card.  I patiently waited, even as the game had started.  After a few minutes another lady came behind the bar.  I quickly said excuse me to the lady.  At this point the Asian lady yelled that it was not her job and that I would have to wait.  I said, but the game is already on.  She said...you know what....turned around and got my card...came over and put my card down and grabbed my beer and said I could go watch the fame somewhere else.  I was completely astonished.  How the hell did she escalate to that.  There was no yelling, I wasn't rude.  How the hell did we get here??? I asked if there was someone I could talk to and she said no and I could call at another time! I couldn't believe it.  I grabbed my card and left.  I would NEVER go to that place again!
author: Jay J.

description:
Popped in for drinks and left with a buzz! Pretty cool spot conveniently located near the ballpark. My group wasn't quite ready to call it quits after an exciting Giants game. Why not one more round before hiking it all the way to Bart right?! 

Drinks are pretty straight forward here. Unsure about the bartender's true level of expertise. This is not exactly your Manhattan up with a soaring pinky kind of establishment. I take my beer cold and my whisky neat. Really though, this spot is cool and pretty laid back. Don't forgot to grab some Jersey's pizza next door.
author: Ralph A.

description:
Came in to watch some basketball and was excited by the prospect. We sat at a table and were trying to decide what to get but got a lot of pressure from the waiters to order. They also said at the table had to buy something while only a few of us were going to actually order. Besides being forced to order, we were rushed to pay and sign while we wanted to stay a little longer and watch basketball. 

I would have understood if it was really busy but the bar wasn't completely full. We were, however, impressed by the prices of drinks here that were much cheaper than other places nearby. The deals for beer is pretty good and while it's a good deal for mixed drinks, they were very bland and didn't really taste like anything.
author: Bito M.

description:
You know how Rick Astley had that song where he sings "Never gonna give you up, never gonna let you down, never gonna turn around and desert you?". Well...I believe he wrote that song based off this bar (seriously).

Your local sports/dive bar located in SOMA where all the neighboring techies come out to enjoy a nice refreshing beverage and the game(s) playing on the TV after a long day/week. 

While this bar is not the best in the area, it is definitely the go-to spot for when you want to catch the Warriors/Giants/Sharks games on a budget, as they have like 10 TVs. 

Pros:
- Free popcorn in the popcorn machine.
- Many TV's to catch multiple games being broadcasted.
- Cheap drinks
- Pool table
- Friendly staff
- Located next to Jersey's Pizza and Capt Eddie Rickenbaucker's (tater tots) for the fixings.

Cons:
- Men's bathroom is a little weird, considering that there is a curtain in place of a stall door. If engaging in #2, PROCEED WITH CAUTION HAHA!

As I was saying with the whole Rick Astley thing, this bar has never let me down when I needed to watch a game or grab a drink.
author: Dustin W.

description:
Solid choice for sports viewing in SoMa. Lots of fans on weeknights and a few diehards are here on the weekends. Steff's has 2 very large screens and about 10 flat screens. Lots of stools at the bar and tall tables against the wall. Very cool bartenders. A nice selection of taps. They make a good bloody mary. So they cover all the bases as far as I'm concerned.

The free popcorn is a nice bonus. You can order a hot dog if you've got a real hunger. And if you're having more rounds after work than you originally planned, it's probably a good idea for your tummy and hangover avoidance. 

Pool table is double bonus - FTW!
author: Ted R.

description:
Whiskey sours in pint glasses?? YES PLEASE. 

Off the beaten path in the financial district. Went on a Monday night so it was far from packed. ESPN and South Park played on flat screens as customers debated how many Americas there are (survey says: 3).

I ordered 4 whiskey sours for myself and a shot for a stranger. I was THAT comfortable my first time there. I didn't see a kitchen but they have bodega styled snacks. There's dart boards, a pool table, and a $10 card minimum.

The only noticeable downside is the curtain for a door in the ladies restroom. WHAT THE ACTUAL FUCK?? A portapotty is more secure. Luckily the bathroom was empty when I went but I couldn't imagine feeling comfortable using the restroom if the bar were packed.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Stumbled upon Steff's after having no luck at The Pink Elephant Alibi down the block. At around 2:30PM on a Sunday, it was completely empty. However, a handful of people slowly started to make their way in throughout the hour that we were there.

$7 for Moscow Mules. Not great MM's unfortunately due to the ginger beer that was used in them. It didn't have the classic bubbly carbonation goodness that your regular MM comes with, so it was flat which felt wrong while drinking. I guess getting beer here would have been a better decision.

However, I gotta admit, the place itself isn't that bad. If you're looking for a frill-less and chill place to drink with friends, Steff's is a good option. Perfect for sports fans, but for those that don't care as much, there's also a pool table to have fun with. Another slight complaint though would be the bathroom. I don't care if the bathroom is old, as long as it's clean and works. However, there was no door for the ladies' bathroom, but rather just a curtain which was strange. Since it was slow, it didn't bother me. But I can imagine when this place gets busy that the curtain could make this awkward.
author: Mars S.

description:
Met up some friends on Thursday, April 21st around 6pm for happy hour and to watch the Golden State Warriors game. It was crowded, but my friends had dropped by earlier than me and were able to snag a couple seats at the bar.

We only spent about half the game here, but I ordered a bunch glasses of Stella Artois. I believe they were $4 each? I think they were having a HH special, but I'm not exactly sure. I think their HH may be 24/7? I vaguely remember seeing a sign that said that. The atmosphere was bustling. A lot of people had the same idea as us and came to Steff's for the game. They also serve bar snacks which were tempting. But we wanted some real food, so we headed elsewhere for the rest of the game.

Fun sports bar for HH. A little too crowded for me, so I'm glad we had seats. If you're going for a game, show up early to snag a table or some bar stools.
author: Elena N.

description: Solid venue to watch a game. The bartenders are also very friendly.  Pool table in the back as well.
author: Rod M.

description:
My friends and I wanted to hit up our favorite pool hall but it was reserved for a private party, yet again.  My friend suggested this place because there's a pool table so why not.  

And there it sat, one, small, old, run down pool table.  PERFECT!  With there only being one table, I was afraid that it was going to be occupied which would've been a huge disappointment but I guess we got there early enough.  $1.00 a game, sweet.

While my friend got a round of Jameson for everyone, I was on the other side of the bar ordering a Coors Light for myself.  $3.50?  Excuse me? $3.50 for beer??!?! This might be our new spot for pool and beers with those prices.

Mix crowd of sports fans, businessmen, and techies.  I met a few people as well; Hi Tim, Jay, Robert, and Diane *waves*

Great service.  Cheap drinks.  Friendly customers.
author: Linda N.

description:
Just watched the past 2 warriors games here and had a great experience! Steff's has a sports bar/dive bar feel to it, but isn't trashy! Since I feel like my life is an everyday happy hour, Steff's 24/7 happy hour is my kind of place. 3.50 to 5.00 beers all day, except for their porters and stouts, paired with 7 dollar Jameson shots, you can't go wrong. Especially for being in the FiDi this is one of the best deals. Also, did I mention the Asian moms being bartenders. They don't really talk but they serve drinks quick! 

During warrior/giants games and Friday nights, this places gets super packed and the service can be kind of slow, but this is worth the money and there's a lot of places to watch from! And what's super special is that you can bring outside food. This bar is located near so many good and affordable restaurants, so you get to drink your heart out with any meal you desire!
author: Eric Joseph D.

description:
First thing you see when you walk towards Steff's is a sign that says "Happy hour 24/7!" Heck yes!

You can't beat $3.50 beers or $7 Jameson shots in the FiDi or SOMA area! 

The bar is kind of small, so it will get crowded during big game days. (It always seems crowded when the Giants are playing.) They have a pool table room in the back, but no seats!

Service is fast, even when there are a million people at the bar waiting to order. These bartenders really know what they're doing!

The women's bathroom is definitely something special. There's only one "stall," but instead of a door, it's a cloth covering. Intrigued? Go ch-ch-check it out!
author: Christine S.

description:
I stand corrected.  This is a great place, and as The City and this part of town evolves, I hope Steff's stays in the mix.

If you want to watch sports in this neighborhood, this is a nice and accessible spot.  It's not pretentious, and this is an area where most bars/restaurants cater to a fairly well-incomed crowd.  The patrons clearly have meaningful SF jobs, if they're local, but there are also several visitors.  It's also right on the corridor down 2nd Street to get from BART to AT&T Park.  So, get a beer, play some pool, eat some popcorn and use the bathroom.  Then go to the game.

The bartenders are great.  And, the more I explore, the more I realize it.  

The bar is in the vicinity of a lot of businesses, so it's a great spot to be if your buddies work/also work somewhere close and want to catch some games.  Like I said - the FiDi/SoMa isn't always chill.  This place is comfortable, but full of good people.

And, it's super accessible to public transit.
author: Adam S.

description: It's a great set up for a sports bar. Lots of TVs that are big and easily seen. Awesome bartenders, good drinks, kind of dive-y but very clean. Has an internet jukebox and a nice vibe. Would recommend
author: Vanessa M.

description: I have been here twice. The first time was in June. Second time September. The bartender remembered me. That's a great bartender.
author: Racheal R.

description:
Bar opens at 9:30am on Sunday. Im not sure if it's during football season. Our bartender, Jenny is very entertaining! 
Miller lites are $3.50 ! The bloody Mary is very good.
author: Deanna a.

description:
A great bar for happy hour in the financial district. It's always good value and is a bright and cheery kinda place. It's a no nonsense kinda American bar with no fancy decor. Good for sports on TV- they also have a pool table and darts.
To keep you going you can have a corn dog from the bar- not the freshest or healthiest option but it might save a bit of the hangover. 
Try this for a happy hour and get the window seat if possible!
author: Derek M.

description: We wanted to catch the end of the Warriors game so we stopped into this bar. It's pretty packed. We huddled around the bar for a little bit. After the game ended though, it cleared out and we grabbed two tables. It was HH on a weekend or they just had specials 24/7 I think. We got some shooters - which I think is in between a shot and mixed drink. It's more liquid than a shot but less than a mixed drink, I guess. There was something called a Gucci shooter and a Warriors shooter. I couldn't tell you what was in them but both were good. Haha. Also tried their version of a Moscow mule - not super authentic or served in a copper cup. But it was sweet and cheap. Seems like a cool place to catch a game. But it's not too big and tables are a hot commodity.
author: Alison W.

description: With Steff's right across the street from my office, my coworkers and I love to pop in for happy hour right after work. Their staff is friendly, cocktails are great, and they have complimentary popcorn :) yum!
author: Clay P.

description: Cheap beers are always a win. Came here for the Warriors game last night and the atmosphere was festive and fun. It was crowded and not much seating. They also advertise food but they were not serving any when we were there. Would be better if they have bar snacks!
author: Joan S.

description:
Great place to watch champions league soccer or any sport. 8+ TVs, 2 of which are large projected screens. 

Close to many restaurants. They let you bring your own food in. $10 minimum. ATM around the corner. 

Pool table in the back.
author: Taylor H.

description:
I came in a a Friday night and had a pretty great time! I don't about all of the negative nancy's, but the music was at an appropriate volume and the bartenders were both really nice, given it wasn't really a crowded night. The people that were there were pretty fun, although there was a benefit event across the street that they may have been coming from.

They have lots of TVs, a dart board, and a pool table that costs $1 in quarters. I would assume the darts are free, but then again, probably not. 

Well drinks were $5.50 and shots were $4.50, but I'm not sure if that was their happy hour deal or not. 

Overall, I had a great experience and enjoyed the atmosphere here. It's certainly your traditional dive bar, but nothing to complain about.
author: Erika S.

description: I've been coming here for a few years now. It's a great place to catch the game(s) and happy hour. The drinks aren't fancy (don't expect any artisanal sh*t here). Drinks are generally strong, though it depends on which bartender you get. I'm pretty sure it's Asian owned, and as an Asian girl, I can tell you I regularly receive a weaker pour than the guys do sometimes (from female Asian bartenders)... They've raised their prices. It's $7.25 for a Jamie Ginger now, and $4.25 I've heard for an IPA. Not sure what's up with the pocket change. Free popcorn (woot woot), and microwave corn dogs hit the spot when you're buzzed. Overall, solid sports bar that I've been frequenting for years, and for years to come, most likely.
author: Andrea L.

description:
Steff's is not fancy. They don't make specialty cocktails. Their beer on tap selection is limited to only standard popular brands.  Heck you can't even get food that can't microwaved! But for all the things that Steff's isn't, one thing it is is a great Sports Bar.  Plenty of TVs and Projectors line the walls.  A pool table in the back and free popcorn round out the offerings.  

The service here is quick and friendly.  You can get a hot dog/corn dog or snack on chips if you are hungry.  The best thing here are drink prices. Starting at $6 dollar shots, you really can't beat that in SOMA/Fi-Di. 

It can get crowded but the crowd does make it fun on game nights!
author: Veasna H.

description:
TV's run the entire span behind the bar area with two gigantic screens on each end on the wall so no matter where you sit you should have a great view of whatever game you want to watch. 

The variety of beers on draft are solid and they have a decent happy hour deal that runs all day but the options were not for me.

They also have a pool table in the back area near the restroom if you want something to do while watching the game. 

Overall Thoughts

A no frills bar great for catching the game
author: Eddie W.

description: 24/7 Happy Hour!  Down the street from work.  Nice Dive Bar feel.  My kind of place to go.  Bartenders are solid.  A co-worker of mine got me hooked on this place, she always went here for her lunch. It was quiet place to have a good conversation and beer. However, when there is a major sports game, the place will get crowded.  They have bar snacks, but you can bring outside food in if you like.  My group of friends ordered a pizza to be delivered here one day.  It was classic.  As long as I work in the area, will definitely keep hitting up this spot.
author: Jeremaine R.

description: I love me some Steffs.  Cheap drinks?  Check.  Great staff?  Check.  Every freakin' game imaginable?  Check!
author: Scott H.

description:
Great staff! I think I rarely speak about how good a staff is because they so often disappoint me. I like Steff's because Steff actually works there and is frequently behind the bar, not micro-managing, but HELPING and taking drink orders. I love when a business owner does this, it shows me that they started the business, yes to make money, but also because they like to interact with the people who pay their bills.

Plenty of beers on tap, cheap mixed drinks, $5 Fernet, TVs galore, a pool table, and a popcorn machine. It's very central so you can make your way around the local Fi Di happy hour spots easily. The crowd is mostly folks getting off work, oh, and there's a juke box. So yea, all in all, Steff's is a cool place.
author: Crystal C.

description: Great neighbourhood feel for the financial district - roomy not too loud. Not crazy about the big daddy IPA but $3 hotdog will make up for that
author: Daniel M.

description: WAAY too crowded and understaffed on game nights; srsly mngmt is dropping a ball here. Otherwise a cool little sports bar dt.
author: Oleg H.

description:
It's a sports bar. You'll probably stumble in here at some point if you're walking around Soma. Personally, I enjoy not-so-crowded pubs, although this is probably just symptomatic of post-Giants celebration, a vacuum of space that, held long enough, will be followed by a rush of activity and energy as we feel the need to fatigue ourselves once more, anxious at having our basic needs satisfied, with no clear container to put our smudge of excess energy -- not so much that we can channel it into self-actualization, not so little we can save it for a rainy day. Caught in between these periods of everlasting ebb and flow, one sits and contemplates what it means...

To be in a sports bar...

In a booming city...

That is slowly losing its geographic diversity...

And yet, you can't escape into it, can't lose yourself in it, for the consciousness always finds a way to intellectualize, cut, and remove oneself from the situation...

So that even between drinks, laughter, and noise, none of which are significant enough to remember in their own right, you have only the unsettling reminder that you will, at some point, either write these fleeting thoughts in a yelp review, or last not long enough to tell the-
author: Christophe C.

description: Jiwon is amazing. So sweet and exactly the way a bartender should be. She made this place from a 2 to 5.
author: Melissa A.

description:
Stopped by here on the way to the BART station from AT&T Park. We wanted to drink, but not somewhere very busy (like lots of bars close to the ballpark). Steff's was ideal since they serve cheap drinks, random snacks, and they're located right next to a train station. I got an Asian ownership vibe here because of the following reasons:
1) Bartenders were Asian aunties
2) They were selling small bags of chips on display at the bar (Asian to me because in many Asian markets they sell anything, anywhere)
3) They didn't card us (we look borderline of-age)

Bottom line, good place to go hard with drinks because of the inexpensive price and no huge crowds fighting for bar space.
author: Marlon T.

description:
This was only my second time here. Got a ESB Red Hook pint for $4.50 while friend grabbed a $5 Hefeweizen. There were no specials on beers during HH. The NIT Basketball Championship and ESPNews (http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/4A2l3rffLiPPHJxEtjIX_g/l) were on most, but not all, of the TVs. This place is similar to a sports bar, but not exactly - it's more like a very clean and bright dive bar? So, that's what I'm going with.

Also noticed it was mainly FiDi-workers and barflies at the time, but those barflies had the best decorum I've seen. They held a conversation with the female bartender without being overly comfortable. And, she was really quick for being the only bartender working at the time (an early Thursday evening).

The restrooms are through a walkway next to a large overhead projection screen (http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/NbHxJyS-zlcs5U9wtp-Mcg/l). Through there is a separate section for the $1/game pool table (http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/YFw5ynFsY48LBojtTZlyTA/l). Can see many stop-ins during the World Cup...
author: Peter L.

description: Pretty cool spot! Lots of monitors which is perfect for a game day/night. The bartender, Lana is so amazing! Tip her well!
author: Meg G.

description:
I've been coming to this place off and on since 1998, why I'm only Yelping it now.....I suck! lol or always inibriated when I leave that I don't remember to....

Last came here on 1/4/2013 at 5:30p as a plan B for a group happy hour coz Dada across the street was ridicuously packed and uncomfortable. Aaaaahhhh, good ole Steffs. You're always gonna be not crowded, with a ball game on, stiff drinks and free popcorn. The best part is that you can bring in your own food from around the way. 

Pros:
-Friendly bartenders good service
-Comfortable, casual and unpretentious atmosphere...come as you are! 
-Pool table in the back.
-BYOF (bring your own food!)
-Juke Box
-Lots of TVs for good sports viewing

Cons:
-The condition and age of the bar isn't the best, (she's not the belle of the ball) it's a bit divey but in a good way. Ladies bathroom is decent and bowls are clean so I'm good!
author: Elizabeth N.

description:
How have I written a bunch of reviews but have not reviewed Steff's!? 

Steffs is a great bar. The drinks are cheap and the people are fun. There are plenty of T.V's and the staff is really friendly. I have watch countless games here and have not regretted the decision. You pay about $3.50 for a Bud or Bud light and $5 for a shot of Fernet or Jameson during happy hour which isn't half bad. The crowd mainly consist of work people but you do get a lot of the construction workers from the trans-bay terminal here so it's a mix of everyone. 

They have free popcorn which is awesome and they do sell corn dogs which is an added perk to the spot. There is also a pool table in the back with plenty of T.V's which I have yet to use. There's a jukebox which has a bunch of hip hop music which is an added plus. I often have come here before I go to a more expensive spot without any hip hop music to use my money wisely haha. You can also come here on your lunch and eat your lunch and enjoy a beer. What more can I say about this place really?? It is always a go to for me and my coworkers and I'll be there tonight as the Giants take game 2 of this World Series!!

Yeah, I think you need to go!
author: Javier G.

description:
Thursday nights are the best with Tiff and Teri at the bar.  There is a group of Korean Americans hanging out them at 930pm.  

The place to be.
author: Jim L.

description: They have 2 really big screens where they play major games plus around 6 smaller TVs for other games by the bar. Drinks are pretty good too ($5 for good beers like Big Daddy and Fort Point and $8 for a Gucci Shooter, which was great!). The crowd was also friendly and I managed to make around 10 friends, just talking to strangers, that night. I would definitely come back. :)
author: Trisha D.

description: I've been here a few times.  A cool bar with one pool table, a lot of tv's and is very small. Not really good for big groups, unless you're lucky enough to get the back where the pool table is at.
author: Joane B.

description:
Bring your own lunch, order a drink & watch baseball. There is a microwave if you need to heat anything up. They have random snacks like chips and popcorn, but I've never seen anyone order those.

Great place to spend your lunch hour!
author: Catheria S.

description:
Yeah yeah yeah - San Fran has great exotic food choices but sometimes I don't want quail eggs moose pate drizzle flambé .. blah blah blah

Sometimes beer & corn dog works just fine and here along with super giant AMC sized big screens - this place is the local sports bar, that has that throw back to the first bar you has a beer in feel to it.

The only place in the area you can spend 3-4 hours and spend less than $25 on 4 beers and a meal.
author: Shawn P.

description:
From a SPORT FAN'S standpoint:

Steff's bar is a great place to go to watch games. Plenty of seats and they have multiple huge flat screen tvs that are mounted onto the wall. They play most of the sports the average San Franciscan/ Bay Area resident would want to watch.

This place can get pretty packed, but on a Thursday night, the place was pretty mellow, only four to five groups of people watching the A's game and the Warriors game.

From a DRINKER'S standpoint:

Drinks are decently priced, cocktails are watered down. This would be the spot to go to if you want to have a couple of beers while enjoying a game.
author: Ada C.

description: Bar is cool, basically your  average sports bar but there is one particular bartender here that I can't stand; She is an older Asian lady. Last time I was here she asked my boy for extra tips and the second time I was here she did not even give me my change back. Just assumed that I wanted to tip her and took my change when I didn't want to give her any tip for her shity service. I am sorry but you can just assume everyone wants to or had to top you, a tip is earned and this lady has not earned a tip either of the time I was here. I will never be coming back because of her and it's a shame because it a decent bar.
author: Melvin P.

description:
Happy hour 24/7. Cheap drinks. Definitely a bar.... bar atmosphere, bar snacks, etc.

Do not come here hungry. I do not even think they have a kitchen.  Everything is made at the bar and there is not a drink menu. So, you must know what you want when you come. 

It is a great place to stop in, grab a drink, watch the game, and leave.  We stopped to watched the Seahawks blow out the 49ers (ha ha ha). Really enjoyed the low key environment.
author: Alex S.

description: Awesome crowd, awesome staff, great environment, good vibes, great place to catch game of your favorite team or just to have a drink after work or shoot some pool. Staff is super friendly and accommodating, will put whatever game you want to watch with no hesitation. Crowd is very sociable and will cheer for your team even if they're not a fan. I'm a Miami native and usually follow the Miami teams specially the Heat. With the big warriors and Giants and A's following in the Bay, I thought I would have to deal with rude obnoxious fans since I'm supporting an out of town team...I couldn't have been more wrong. Yes there is the usual healthy small smack talk from staff and clients, which is totally fine, but everyone is genuine & just there to mingle, have a few brewskis, catch a game or just have a good time...prices are fair for the location, free popcorn, no food except I think corn dogs and hot dogs but the best part is that they allow you to bring in your own food and eat it right there !! I mean who does that? Love this place, I see myself becoming a regular given the proximity from work!
author: Anouar M.

description: The staff is awesome. Great tv coverage. Jenny kills it at customer satisfaction, and everyone is great. Great pool table, jukebox and corn dogs to grub on.
author: steven M.

description:
A watering hole, that just happens to run sports on a bunch of flat screens?  Sure.  But Steff's is much much more than that to many a student and Instructor alike.  It's a home away from home during semesters when a 12 hour day turns into night.

The drinks, Stiff.  The price.  Cheap.  The bartenders.  Awesome.  

Even when its crowded after Giants games, there is an air of 'How are you, what's up?  Have a shot.'  

It ain't glamorous.  But then again it doesn't have to be.
author: Steve R.

description:
Love this bar. 

Jukebox. 

Pool.

Multiple televisions with different games!

Bar stools. 

Shots, shots, shots, beer, and more beer.

Super inexpensive and a good time. 

Side note: SUPER clean restrooms!
author: Kristin H.

description:
I've been here a couple of times during the day to watch some World Baseball Classic games, and everything was fine. The prices are reasonable, staff is friendly, and the space is nice.

That said, the tvs are a bit too high. My neck started to hurt after just a half hour watching the game. If a sports bar is a place to watch sports, this is a problem.
author: Nicholas F.

description:
Cheap beer, friendly bartenders and a ton of screens to watch the game on. All around a great dive bar. 

If you're there on a non-game night, there is a pool table and juke box to keep things lively. Free popcorn at the back of the bar to boot!

Tends to be busier during the happy hour rush, but mellows down later in the evenings.

By far one of the places I frequent most in the city. Always an awesome time, with a ton of energy on game days
author: Sam M.

description:
We came, we saw, we conquered!

In San Francisco for the weekend and needed a place to watch the Seahawks game on Sunday afternoon.  Called Steff's and they said that they would have the game on at least one TV.  True enough, the game was on and surprisingly, the Seahawk fans outnumbered the 49er fans due so many of us being in town for the Husky game on Friday.

We settled in to root for the Seahawks and the Arizona Cardinals, who were playing the 49ers.  Thankfully the Seahawks won the game.  While not quite conguering, it was what we wanted.

But the rating is not based on the game, but the bar.  As has been stated before, this is an in city dive bar.  Decent selection of beer, but the only food is nuts, chips, or microwaved hot dogs.  But you are not restricted to this meager menu.  They quickly point out you can bring in food as long as you clean up after yourself.  We went across the street to Subway and bought our lunch.

Bottom line - good place to watch a football game, but bring your own food and enjoy!
author: John F.

description: In a city of excess and overdone everything, Steff's just gets the job done.  Great staff, good food, fun crowd.  Very reasonable prices and lots of TVs.
author: Mark D.

description:
Went here for a pre-drink before having an amazing meal with friends around the corner.  We ordered a very simple drink:  Greygoose Soda.  (my drink of choice everywhere) 

Not sure what the deal was, but, it didn't taste like my usual drink.  We both agreed and left our drinks there full.  I won't come back again.
author: Delilah B.

description:
I can officially say this will be "the sports bar" around work. Bartenders here are nice and they take care of me. Two projections TV to watch any Bay Area sports, as well as a couple of HD TVs scattered around the bar for your viewing pleasures. 

Another plus here is the free popcorn and a pool table in the back. 

I always have a good time here.
author: Dave L.

description:
Unremarkable sports bar that's a little pricey (it's in line with nicer places, but it's not nice). 

I'm a variable tipper. When the service is really good, I tip 40%, when it's poor, I don't tip. I tipped 10%. Sure it was low, but that's my choice. The bartender came by and asked why I didn't tip her more. I told her I tipped as much as I felt appropriate in a very matter of fact way and she walked off. 

Then...another random bartender came up to ask the exact same question (they both phrased it like they were concerned about the service). I told her in a very polite way, that we were having a good time before they came by, and this is entirely inappropriate. I then asked her to take off the tip altogether and we left. 

I suppose we looked like out of towners because we were caring our laptop bags everywhere (training in SF). She was trying to embarrass me in front of my co-workers and guilt me into tipping more. 

We went to the Thirsty Bear and grabbed some appetizers and got a better deal on the beer (plus they have a better selection). I'm sure there's some other good places around here as well.
author: Michael R.

description:
Steff's is always friendly and takes care of the regulars as well as new customers. Since outside food is allowed, a quick lunch while sitting down for a drink makes perfect sense. 

Also, there are TV's everywhere!! Great place to watch your favorite team.
author: Brandon M.

description:
Steff's is only the second stop of my group's WooHooFriday Happy Hour, yet somehow almost every time we come we stay for hours. 

Great sports bar, simple, nothing too crazy but lots of TVs, lots of tables, good happy hour crowd, always showing the game!

People are super friendly here.  Without fail, every time I come here someone will point to me and say "SHOT, whaddaya want?" 

One time the bartender didn't know what was in a screwdriver, but hey that's cool everybody has a first day at work.  

Also, free popcorn, good distance to Muni.

Ladies:  There is no door in the bathroom, just a curtain.  It's been this way snice I can remember it, I wonder what angry woman ripped off the door in the past.  Anyways, if you super have to pee but tend to be a bit pee-shy or haven't had enough cocktails to take away your shame, go over to Osha Thai right down the street, tell whoever the host/hostess is that your party is already inside, brush past them to the bathroom and leave.  If this type of behavior makes you feel guilty, then you should eat something there every now and then to calm your conscience, the volcano beef is a good start.

Another great thing about Steff's is that if you come in when you are still obviously on the clock because you wanna have a beer and catch part of a game, they don't give you shit for it which is really nice.
author: Megan A.

description: For me it's a good pre and post Giants game bar. For others it seems to be a good post work bar.
author: Brayden S.

description: So I went in for a shot of fernet. Bartender was nice. Poured me a shot. I put a 10.00 bill on the bar. It was 7.00. Which is fine. As I was taking my shot, a different bartender (woman with pink hair) came and took my 3.00 and put in her tip jar. Wtf?  I would have tipped but wait for me to finish my drink and leave my tip. Don't assume. And you didn't even serve me Miss Pink. !!!!!   I won't be back.  Tacky!
author: Samantha Y.

description: Great bar to watch sports. My only criticism is that they don't have enough bar tenders. Great example is yesterday's US soccer match. There was great turnout for the game, so the bar was PACKED!!!!!!!!! The bar started off with one bar tender, which was fine until the game actually started and people rolled in. At the end, the bar was spilling over into the street and the two bar tenders were struggling to fill orders fast enough. The bar could make so much more money if they planned accordingly. And yes, World Cup is an event that people will turn up for, so to the owners, please plan!
author: Ricardo M.

description: Reasonable prices on beer & drinks. Friendly staff. Lots of TVs. Get there early for popular games (World Cup, Giants, playoffs). Popcorn & pool table available. No happy hour prices, since prices are pretty low already.
author: Foo L.

description: Place was so loud I couldn't take it. After 1 beer we had to leave. I like that they have the volume on for the game, but it was too loud.
author: Rodney D.

description: You can bring your own food here and they have huge screens to watch the games.  Parking is not too bad depending on what time you come.  Good place to watch a game and have a beer.
author: Chris L.

description: Avoid this place! After leaving a deserved $1 tip, the bartender hunted me down and reamed me out. She was a bully and kept repeating, "this can't be right, $1 tip? This can't be right, $1 tip?" Needless to say, I won't be returning.
author: Bre S.

description:
Steffs Sports Bar
SF: South of Market (SoMa)
December 31, 2010
3 Star Bar

Cheap Drinks and Open Pool Table = what more could you ask for.  It is always weird going to a sports bar when there is not a game on.  But this place was enjoyable pit stop.
author: Leonard L.

description: The old Korean lady here demands that you tip her at least 15% even if you didn't get any food, her service and attitude were sub polar, so you can imagine why some people avoid her or avoid coming here altogether
author: Keoini H.

description: Came in for a drink before a show at the Harlot a block over. It's not a very nice place, so we thought we could get some cheap drinks. I got a vodka redbull, which ended up being $10 because they give you the can of redbull to keep. Why on earth would I want a 3/4 full can of redbull to carry around with my drink?! In addition to that, when I went to the bathroom I was surprised to find that THE DOOR IS A CURTAIN!!!! This place literally could not be ghettoer. On the upside, if you're hammered, they do sell hot dogs and packages of beef jerky.
author: Lauren O.

description:
FOOD/DRINK:
1.) Corn Dog... haha! They have corn dog! Perfect scratch for a snacking itch ;P
2.) Beer 


ATMOSPHERE:
Cool place to chill wether a night of bar crawling or sitting around in the lazy Sunday afternoon to pretend to watch a game. Small pool table in back, big screens around, almost divey layout, nice and clean tho

10.11
author: Angela L.

description:
BOOM FOOTBALLLLLLLLLLLLL!

So off to a sports bar for some Sunday rowdiness with the local crazy fans! Steff's was cool. I have been here before and it has a good mix of what you want and what you need in a bar. Obviously a big ass TV and good beer along with food to eat make everything start just right.

The second main point is a good crowd that doesn't get blind drunk. That way you can cheer and have fun without worrying about someone breaking a bottle and trying to kill the guy next to him because he questioned the replay official on if it was a catch or not.

Great day of sports!
author: Nick B.

description:
I'm from out of town and came with a friend who knew a bartender. I had a great experience, though biased I suppose. 

The bar has tons of televisions and big screens with a multitude of games and sports on. There is a squeezed in pool table in the back before the restrooms. The ladies room is built for girls to gather around the entry door is open(not locked), but it is a single stall. 

Our waitress, my friend's friend, was very nice not only with us but other tables and people at the bar. She took our orders and chatted with us, but didn't neglect her job. We got some yummy shots and I told her I liked sweet stuff and wouldnt mind experimenting. She brought out a segrem's cookies and cream? I thought I'd absolutely hate it but it was pretty good!

Over all crowd was a good mix not a sausage fest which is a surprise for a sports bar. It was a Thursday night.
author: Rany N.

description: Needed a bar after midterms.  TOOO few bars are open at noon on saturdays. Actually surprising.  This one was open. served my purposes. Prices seemed ok and they did have very very light food available. I didn't eat but the prices seemed totally fair.  The bartender was really friendly and chatty since we were basically her only customers and she handled our big group really well.
author: Stephanie D.

description: Cozy little sports dive bar. Went here for the World Series game and it was a good crowd, TV's everywhere with a strong snack and drink selection. The management was pretty intense about not letting people in, but I understand this is probably a fire code thing. Would def come back here to watch a game and chomp on some free popcorn.
author: Milan T.

description: Sports on the TVs and very reasonably priced beer makes this place a favorite of mine. All the bartenders are super nice too.
author: Stephen F.

description:
Local Coworker Bar! 

This has turned into my after work bar.  Been stopping in frequently, because the coworkers love watching the games here.  They have tons of TV's and a large projector displaying the games that are on.  There's not much of a HAPPY HOUR menu, prices are the same after work and after hours?! The upside of the bar, is they have tons of tables to fit all of us and a FREE popcorn machine.  

MAJOR TURN OFF is the women's restroom. How come there isn't a DOOR? I always ALWAYS have to ask a coworker to come with, so no one will just open the curtains on me while I am doing my business.

No matter the mood,.  whether if we are celebrating a happy moment, sad moment, frustrated moment,. 

" Hey guys, let's go to STEFFS to have a drink"  

See you next week!
author: Chanel L.

description:
I went in at 3:30 PM because I had nothing better to do.  

The bartender was extremely friendly and offered to put on any game and pump the sound for any TV that I wanted.  The selection of alcohol was solid and not too pricey.  Additionally, free popcorn was given to everyone in attendance. 

The TVs were all fairly new and they apparently had Direct TV and any sports channel imaginable.  All in all, seemed like a chill place to watch a game and do a little drinking.
author: Shane M.

description: Nice place to stop and have a drink before going to the game or staying here and watching it on their many TVs.  Bartender was very nice and helpful.
author: David M.

description:
Only been here during weekday lunch. Thursday and Friday college basketball tournament games were on and we needed a spot to eat and watch. This place gets two thumbs up for allowing us to bring food in. Very accommodating and service was great. There was a one drink minimum which is reasonable. For a small place, they had a lot of flat screens tv all along the wall, with one larger projector in the front. I could see this place being a very chill place to hang out after work. 

I would definitely come back here in the future.
author: Chris Y.

description: Awesome bartenders!!! ALINA is by far my favorite!!! Prices are reasonable! I normally get tequila sunrise or a shot of Jameson!!! Yummy :-) :-)
author: Dominique G.

description: If I could give zero stars, I would. This place is not friendly. I was recently robbed outside of the bar, and went inside to ask the bartender to call 911, as my phone had been taken in the robbery. The bartender, who was not busy, refused to even acknowledge my request. Not a place I want in my neighborhood.
author: Marie M.

description:
Sports bar review:

Flatscreens? Check! 
Sausage fest? Check!
Bartender service? Hmmm... 
Decor? Divey.

Located on 2nd st just south of Market, this little bar is a convenient spot to duck into if you want to catch a sports game before/during/after work. It's clean enough to not be completely divey, but it's on the divey side. Sweet korean bartendress probably isn't mixologist- or she might be if you order in korean- but being a basic sports bar you're better off with the basics. 
Bar seats were fully occupied by men at 5pm on a weekday. There were student types, older regulars who probably have butt imprints on a stool and guys who clearly just ducked out of the office. 

Single Ladies, are you reading?
author: Kim K.

description:
This is the go-to place for a drink and a corndog. They have a bunch of flat screens playing whatever sports games are on, a dartboard, and a pool table.

They also have 151, which means you can get a Galvatron here! Usually, it's $11 depending on which bartender you get. http://ngobros.wordpress.com/2010/05/28/galvatrons-amazing-yes/

I've been here a LOT because I go to school nearby, but it's a great chill place to grab a drink with friends, so if you come by, you'll probably run into me sometime! Holla atcha boy!
author: Louis N.

description:
The night started out at 111 Minna, but we eventually found ourselves capping the night off at Steff's, looking for a chill sort of way to send ourselves home.

Although I guess it's technically a dive bar, the place itself is actually kind of nice.  It's still a true sports bar, since some variation of ESPN seemed to be playing on all the screens, but it's not like a trendy hipster kind of bar as far as I could tell.  Bonus points that the tables don't feel like they've been soaked in beer over the years, and the entire place itself feels like it's still a bit new.  On this Friday night, there was plenty of stool seating at the bar or the surrounding tables, and the crowd never really built up beyond a dozen people or so.  While it didn't make for the liveliest of scenes, it was perfect for us to just sit, talk, and relax with a pint.  They also have a pool table neatly tucked away in the back if you want to give it a whirl, though I didn't catch anyone playing it while we were there.

And speaking of beer, one of only two places that I now know of that serves Carlsberg in the city!  Granted, I'm sure there are a number of other places that have it, but this is one of the few that I know of for sure.  Yet, sadly enough, I didn't even order it since I didn't find out until we were just about done.

In any case, they also have a short menu of sausages and dogs you can choose for to supplement your frosty brew.  $2 Corndogs were our snacks of choice (served all day with the $2.75 hot dogs...sausages are only during the day), and they hit the spot despite being the microwaved type from Costco.  Then again, when you're looking for a chill drinking spot, it doesn't really get more chill than a $2 microwaved corndog in one hand and a beer in the other, does it?
author: Mike L.

description:
1 - cheap beer
2- tons of tvs
3 - $1.50 corn dogs and hot dogs
4 - A great place to watch a game

What else needs to be said?
author: Carlos A.

description:
I walked into Steff's bar in a seriously bad mood after having a couple drunk buddies ruin a Giants game for me, leading to my 3rd inning departure from the game.  It was a Friday night and I got to the bar by the 4th inning, in serious need of a friendly ear and a cold beer while catching the rest of the game.  The bartender, Julie, was awesome.  Even though it was busy, she managed to use those magical bartender powers and keep my drink full, listen to me lament having to leave the game early and keep everyone else at the bar topped up all at the same time.

I have worked in the service industry a long time and so I am picky, especially when it comes to my bartender, I expect alot.  I will be returning to Steff's to catch games whenever I can't find myself a ticket in the future.
author: Brian F.

description:
This place is a great place to go watch a sporting event and have a few cheap drinks while there. 

I watched Game 3 of the World Series here, and while all the bars around AT&T Park were extremely crowded with long waits to get in, this bar had a great crowd with the same passion but without the overwhelming body odor. 

This bar is also great because they have CORN DOGS! It basically brings back childhood in every bite and you can regain your adulthood by downing the cheap drinks they have here.
author: Langdon N.

description:
Meh. I've experienced better... This is the yelp definition for a 2 star review and I concur. 

A. This sports bar has huge potential but why do I always find it deserted. I've been here a few times and never found a crowd. C'mon I've experienced better sports bars. 

B. The pool table SUCKS big time. The table sucked 3 years ago and its still the same.. C'mon guys if you'll charge 9 bucks for a glass of house wine you can afford to have a decent table. Pool tables are'nt that expensive. 

C. I wonder if it's legal to have underage bartenders. I am not accusing anyone here but I felt my bartender was underage and needed a class or two in mixology. She didnt have a clue about Merlot versus Cabernet when I requested for one. But I made it easy for her and asked her for the house red wine. :) 



I felt cheated after going here. I'd recommend Dada's thats a block away and its so much more fun there.. seriously. ;)
author: Rahul P.

description:
This is probably the first legit sports bar I've ever been to. Im not a sports-bar kinda guy, but I really like this place. Decent drinks, very inexpensive, pool table, free popcorn! Jukebox, GIGANTIC-ASS TV. 

I like going here on Fridays to just unwind and bitch and gripe about the week. I kind of feel bad for the bartender, who I have always seen as this solo asian lady. She's super super sweet and gets your drinks on time, I just wise they'd give her some support out there, especially when a group of 40 1Ls comes in and bombards her
author: Dustin H.

description:
I like Stefs, but that is probably because I am a big sports fan. Good drinks, crowd, and they have all the big games. 

Tip: do not come here with a pretty girl you are still trying to get to know. You can't focus on her...
author: Mark M.

description: Ok but the kinda a bar where you just buy beer or shots not many taps either lots of tvs though a few big ones
author: Michael S.

description:
Apparently the Moscone crowd didn't venture this far... every bar in SOMA was packed on Friday night after work. Ta-da, then we walked into Steff's! All we wanted were two seats, beer, and a reasonable noise level to make an exchange in conversation possible.

It was busy, but there was a spot for us right at the bar. The bartender was on top of her game and the beer flowed for a couple of hours. The Tiger's game was on and there were plenty of TV's for all. 

Definitely enjoyed Steff's for happy hour.
author: Kristin F.

description:
There's not much not to like about Steff's--stiff drinks, not so high prices, friendly bartender, chill ambiance, and plenty of TVs.  OH, I can go on...pretty spacious, pool table, electronic juke box, and erotic photo hunt (my friends have the current high score)...definitely makes for a fun night.

Nice that you can bring your own food, and sometimes they have food like hot dogs and chips.  

Go for the neighborhood bar feel/chill atmosphere....without the smell of stale beer and annoying bar flies.
author: Marie B.

description:
NCAA Tournament March Madness + arriving a little late (5:30pm) = watching the end of the almost Pitt vs Xavier upset outside. 

Get here early if you want a seat or it's to the sidewalk you go. Beware oncoming traffic.
author: Earl G.

description: Nice place for happy hour after work. It's not super packed, easy to get drinks, and has big flat screen TVs for sports games - hence, sports bar. The bartenders are super nice and the drinks are reasonably priced. It's definitely not a "classy" bar, but a good hang out spot for a drink or two.
author: Michelle L.

description:
The lack of food is a little (wait, more like very) disappointing.  It's nice that they let you bring IN food to make up for it.  But wouldn't we both benefit if you had a nice menu of bar foods to compliment my beers?  

This place additionally disappointed me when I needed an 11am bar near work to watch world cup games.  How about Steff's!  I thought.  But dealing with a cover charge so early in the morning was definitely not happening. We ended up having drinks/lunch and game watching at the Palace instead.

Considering how this place is within walking distance from the office and there will be plenty more times when I have an after-work sports need, I will probably be back.  But the minute I find a better sports bar nearby - I'm outta here.  Suggestions anyone?
author: Sarah Z.

description: Great location, good drinks, inexpensive, and a fun place...down to earth bar, decor and waitstaff, and good to unwind, have a couple cheap drinks, and move on...not a "stayer", but good for a starter
author: R J.

description:
This is a friendly, casual, neighborhood type bar in the middle of the FiDi. 
It is a sports bar rather than a pick-up bar, with flat screens for your sports and friendly bartenders. 

They even serve a little food, like hot dogs! They can make any drink, but doesn't focus on the trendy, young flavored drinks like the lounges that try too hard. 

Come in here for an adult beverage and relax, without trying too hard.
author: Wanugee N.

description:
Dropped in here last week to catch some of the UCLA v. USC football game. (Go BRUINS! Too bad we lost. Meh.) Awesome picture quality, though! I should watch sports in hi-def more often.

So basically, it took me 1.5 beverages to stop feeling my nose.  GREAT value on the drinks here!  I was a little hungry though -- so maybe that would explain it.  I took a star away because there was no food to eat here.  Come on, it's a sports bar! If i wasn't waiting to meet up with friends for dinner, I would've probably been more upset about that. I took another star away since the bartender seemed kind of annoyed/unhappy.  :/

Anyhoo, I really liked the low key vibe of this place.  I will be back.
author: Christine C.

description:
I came here last night with a friend, after work around 'happy hour' time. 

I wasn't overly impressed. If you're into sports and want to watch a game, this would be an ideal place to do that. They have a ridiculous amount of flat screen TVs and also serve corn dogs and hot dogs.

I wasn't in the mood for beer, and luckily they do have a full bar. Their carbonation machine/whatever it is called wasn't working for some reason, so I couldn't get a jack and coke or gin and tonic. I settled on a somewhat weak and diluted vodka cranberry. Blah.
author: Gina G.

description: It's an ok spot. place looks beat down and the "Bartenders" don't know half the stuff you are ordering. I've had to tell them couple of times how to make a simple drink. cheap drinks though. Has a "pool table" which you have to literally hit couple of times after you put money in for ALL the balls to come out.
author: Xander B.

description:
Ok so I was in town looking for a place to practice darts. So I walked in and asked the bartender if they had a dart board. He pointed to one on the wall and I ran to the hotel down the road to grab my darts.
My coworker and I returned a half hour later ordered drinks and started playing a few games.
The place was slow and bartender was obviously board. 
In the middle of our third game we were about to order new drinks and his friend walked in. She sat down said something. Then about two minutes later he stated that he was closing due to an emergency. What its 8 pm, If I owned the place I would fire him! 
So we payed our tab and ran down the street to find another dart board.
Looks like a cool place, but I can give it more than one star based on my experience.
author: Scott B.

description: This place is just a really basic sports bar, but it has everything you need! Plenty of HDTV's around the place to watch soccer, football, and yes, even baseball.  The beer is always served ICE cold which makes it freaking refreshing.  If you want to take a break from work, and want to catch an important game, this is the place to go when you're in the SOMA/Financial District!
author: Austin R.

description: LOVE this bar! This is and always will be my favorite bar of all time, they make their drinks strong, I love the bar tenders and very decent priced. Even though I moved to the Mission I still come here as much as I possibly can. I still have all my birthdays and other celebrations here. I honestly do not have a single bad thing to say about Steff's.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
This place was pretty fun.  A dive bar, but fun.  They have an internet jukebox and a pool table to keep you entertained.  The bartender (a female) made nice stiff drinks.  The location isn't bad either, if you want to bar hop there are other places around.  It was kind of dead in there when I was there, it was a tuesday at around 6pm though, so I will have to come back.  

Bonus... they give you super salty popcorn.

Not so much of a Bonus... when you have to buy more drinks because you're thirsty.

Beware.  :)
author: Stacy S.

description: Lots of TVs, moderately priced drinks. Biggest downside, no food service. Can be a deal breaker.
author: Mika O.

description:
The best thing about this place is that the drinks are very moderately priced. So it's a good place to go after work for a beer or a cocktail without having to worry about dropping $12 bucks on a drink. Beer is $5/pint. Well drinks are about $6. I've been here a couple times and it's a good place to go to watch a game. It's never too crowded either and there's almost always free popcorn. They don't have a whole lot of food options but they're pretty cool about letting you bring in outside food. Would definitely recommend Steff's. 

NOTE: Occasionally there may only be one server which results in having to wait a while for a drink, but even then, it's not too painful if there's a good game on to watch while you wait!
author: Tushar K.

description: Young. Sporty. Bar.  The bartenders were not that good.  Kind of slow and oblivious to the patrons that wanted drinks.  You literally have to flag them down if they even look your way.  I think these young bartender girls are first timers and I would not order specialty cocktails from them.  But I do say, the patrons who hang around this place are sports fans because they can watch games on the many tvs they have in the joint.  Plus its a mixture between workers in FIDI and people who live close by.  There aren't too many sports bars in the area anymore.  This could be the only one left...
author: Gina S.

description: Great place to watch sports - I caught the futbol match there last week, and even though we were sitting in the back corner, the waitress continually came by to make sure we were happy. Good beer selection as well.
author: Ryan I.

description:
Great little sports bar in the soma area to grab a drink and watch a game. Beers range from $3 to $6, super affordable. Bartenders are nice but definetly no-non sense. There's no pretense and it's no-frills but why do you go to a bar but to drink and chat, right? 

If you're looking for a chill place to hang with your friends, this is the spot for you!
author: Ka C.

description:
I never wanted to go in here because I thought it was called Stiffs and I generally don't like sports bars. 

I realize Steff's self identifies as a "sports bar" but to me it's just a typical neighborhood bar. When I was there I didn't see any frat boy types obnoxiously hooting at the TV. They have a few TVs showing sports but so does the 500 Club sometimes and no one is calling them a "sports bar". 

The bartenders and the regulars are friendly. They have Anchor Steam and Red Hook ESB on tap so there are at least two acceptable choices. 

They do charge $5 a pint for beer but that seems to be the regular price now outside the Mission. 

I'd come here again if other people wanted to but wouldn't choose it myself.
author: Manny F.

description:
Steff's, I am still mad at you for charging a cover during the world cup.  I had to run to Kate O'brien's to see Spain win (and yes, I did purchase a beer.)  This is why you are a last resort bar, but I still like you.

Just don't do it next time, m'kay?
author: Michelle P.

description:
I've been to Steff's twice.  

The first visit was before a Giants game and I managed to drink ~5 drinks in less than an hour.  That was a fun Giants game.  

For my second visit, I decided I'd climb up the alcoholic latter and have a few drinks at Steff's by myself.  No one talked to me.  I watched baseball.  I got a little drunk.  Perfection.  

Now, I'm madly in love with dive bars, but I'm sick of super crowded dive bars with hipsters all over.  I get it.  Dive bars are all the rage.  Awesome.  But Steff's is a true dive bar.  Crazy people.  Old men. Frat boys.  Hot anti-social girls (me, obviously).  It's a wonderful mix.
author: Annie G.

description: This place is cool when it's not packed.  A great place to watch sports and drink some beer and within walking distance from BART.  There's also a pool table in the back to play on - if not already taken.
author: Amanda K.

description:
Great Happy Hour bar, but that's about it.  I don't see this place being nothing more, but that doesn't always mean its a bad thing.  If you are looking for a place for a good happy hour and has a dive bar atmosphere, this is the place for you.

It also is a good place to start your drinking if you are kicking it around the SOMA area, but there are some creeper people in here in the evening.  Came through here for the first to kill sometime before moving on to another bar during the march madness season this  year.  We were the only folks rooting for the UCSB Gauchos...too many CAL folks up here.  

The beers are good, the price is alright, but the real plus is the popcorn machine that everyone can grub on.  There also is a back room with billiards table, but I always forget that's back there lol.
author: Mark L.

description:
"Wait? How have YOU not been to Steff's yet?!" he said as if I would be so self-absorbed as to patron places with my name or nickname somewhere in the title....

http://www.yelp.com/biz/stephanies-on-newbury-boston#hrid:fkV7cUg0MaTAlbDTUMnGiA

http://www.yelp.com/biz/stacks-san-francisco#hrid:WMMd0N_LeiF-UjhjOJ6tOA

Oh. Okay, ya got me. Doh! So yeah, I hadn't been to the little sport's bar with my name near work until last night, but I must say, it definitely served its purpose in the form of 3 whiskeys on ice after a pretty shit day.

We walked in and it was pretty empty. Perfect. I don't often need people around me when I am ready to punch a wall, or so said the judge that one time in Bakersfield, but I don't like to talk about that. The bartender was friendly enough and I couldn't really tell you much about the 3 patrons as I was focused on the convo at hand with my buddy.

The one thing I will say I didn't dig about this place was the bathroom. It's a little too, um, get a little closer, don't be shy for my taste. You see, there is only a curtain. Not a door, but a curtain, so if there had been more than the 3 dudes hanging out and say, drunken chicks were waiting for the bathroom, not sure how excited I would be to be doing my business with a mere curtain protecting me. Newp, not a fan.

And so, I can see coming back here if it was on the dead side after work again, but as a sufferer of public bathroom paranoia and far from a washer and dryer if the price is right, the curtain was a deal breaker.
author: Stephy S.

description: Awesome bar for those who like bars. Keep in mind it is a sports bar and kinda dive-y for the area. I would advise not to go right when everyone gets off work, but there is free popcorn, decently priced drinks, good bartenders, and an awesome owner. The wall behind the bar is covered in TVs as well as two huge projectors for the tech nuts. The bar tends to get a bit loud when it's full, but everyone has a good time! This place is nothing fancy, but it's real and the people are nice! And if they aren't then you can always tell the staff and they will do what they can. I have watched tiny little bartenders wrestle kegs into the fridge just to get someone the beer they wanted when the keg blew, and replace spilled drinks without ever complaining! If you want someplace genuine you should stop by, watch a game, an grab a drink! It's also every dog friendly, had to stop the bartender from giving my dog too many treats...it would make her far too spoiled.
author: Rachel L.

description: IF YOU'RE A SPORTS FAN, this place is perfect- plenty of games on. If you're a soccer fan you'll be pleased that they were playing a concacaf game last week on one of their several screens. Bar food in it's purest form (dogs, chips, general assortment of grease) and cheap drinks. Very cool place to chill, enjoy a drink with friends while catching a game.
author: Amy M.

description:
The first thing you have to know about Steff's is that Teri should be your friend.  Teri - the gorgeous Asian bartender with fabulous clothes.  Trust me, you'll know her when you see her.  Oh, to have her tiny figure!

I'm a law student.  And I became accustomed to Steff's, if you will, during a particularly awful semester of Property II.  My friend and I got to know Teri while we killed a few beers studying real covenants (trust me - "touching and concerning" is not as interesting as it sounds).  Teri is awesome--so we try to come back as often as possible.  

So while Steff's might not be the cutest, trendiest bar with sparkling-clean everything and sports on all the time, my extraordinarily low bar bill and attentive company brings me back as often as my student loans will allow.

Also, they sometimes have Law & Order on.  And...well... I'm a fan.
author: Jennie K.

description:
Good beer selection at solid prices during happy hour.
Big TVs and good crowd.
author: Mike L.

description: If you're looking for a sports bar with multiple food choices, this is not the place. If you're looking for a place to watch the game, have a drink, and are cool with ball park type foods this is the place.
author: Alex H.

description: I wish I could explain to you why I like Steff's. It's absolutely like any other sports bar you've been to except maybe with slightly less jerks--at least on weekday nights. I love going there during Giants games because people get in to it without going crazy. It's a big space and there are a bunch of small tables opposite the bar where you can hang out and watch the games on the five or so massive TVs. They also have Widmer on tap which is always a plus.
author: Paul C.

description: Good spot to watch a game or have an after work drink -- but a word of caution, the seats are filled a few minutes after 5, and it's uncomfortably crowded not long after.  This place passes my "coke for color" test (ie: mixed drinks are mostly translucent = pretty damned strong).   I find the crowd here annoying sometimes, but it's not bad for the area, really.
author: Heidi M.

description:
Walked into here with 4 friends on Saturday evening, grabbed the pool table, and watched the Final Four games.  Maybe 8 other people here so the atmosphere was nice to just kick it with friends.  Pool is $1 a game.

Beer: $5 for a pint of Red Hook ESB, Anchor Steam, and the Hef.  

BYOF:  The bartender told us we can grab food from elsewhere and bring it in.  NICE.  They do have corn dogs.

Overall: nice place to kick it with friends when you're bored of your living room and want pool, tv, and beer.
author: Sheetal S.

description: Only been here once, but will definitely want to come back. I never really checked out bars around the downtown area, but this is the type of bar I'd love to hangout and chill. Lots of TVs and theres jukebox that you can pick your music. The place seems very relaxed and the people definitely seem very nice. It did take a little longer to get your drinks, but hey, if you're in a good atmosphere and good hangout spot, then its worth the wait. Check it out!
author: Sappho C.

description:
After 5 minutes of being ignore at Motorcycle Bar [yeah, that's not the official name, but you know the place I mean], my coworker and I went next door and snagged some stools at Steff's.  And had a very decent time.

South African rugby?  Sign me up [to watch].  I was amused that they thought my Crown & Coke order was sophisticated.  I guess this is more a Jack & Coke kinda place.  I meant to ask if they had Old Granddad behind the bar, because the place looked like it would've, and I love a shot of really cheap crap now and then.

I'm not sure how many metrosexuals have been offended by the alleged lack of hygiene in this place, but I saw nothing wrong, either with the bar itself or the bathroom.  Anyone who orders a hot dog off a heated roller in a bar should know what they're getting into.  I passed.

I've said it before, I'll say it again: this is NOT a dive bar.  San Franciscans really seem to have no concept of what a dive bar actually is.  There was no one in the bar who had been released from prison that day.  There was no one in the bar who would likely be going to prison for what they did that day.  The waitress was neither bigger, stronger, nor hairier than me.  The TV screens did not have chain-link in front of them.  That's like 4 strikes against it being a dive bar.  It's just a small, cheap, decent place to have a drink without 22 former frat boys calling you "bro."

I'll take it.
author: Ben P.

description:
Dropped in here last night after seeing my friend off at the BART station.  I figured that, as many times as I've walked by and said, "Hey, I need to stop in there sometime", it was time to do so.

Pretty clean, decent place overall.  Pool table in the back (as well as the restrooms), and easy to navigate.  Plenty of televisions, though it didn't make sense to have two adjacent ones on the same Olympics channel ;)

The asian guy that was bartending seemed pretty on top of things, but then it wasn't necessarily packed at 9pm either.  Prices were decent, as was the crowd.

I'll definitely stop in again and see if I can "up" the rating.
author: Jay B.

description:
its a sports bar. nothing special.  drinks weren't cheap.  not very crowded after financial district HH, unless there's a giants game on.  

last time i was there, our bartender was horrible. the gal was a text machine. i ordered a guinness.  she said she had to run to the back to grab some more cans.  half way to the back she stopped and just started texting.  a minute or two past and she gets into the back....  5 minutes past, i can only assume that she was finger mashing her phone back there. i finally got my guinness and was a happy kid.  
little later i needed another drink, she took my order, then started texting again, but this time right in front of me. then came back and took my order again.  this went on the whole time i was there.

the other bartender looked like she wanted to stab her coworker.
author: Sean K.

description:
My bar review seat-mate called me and wanted to meet up for a drink.  This somehow turned into going downtown to see his friend the bartender.  At Steff's.  

So this guy came over from Russia sometime in 1994, and we got to talking about Russian vodkas (he likes Grey Goose best - isn't that some kind of treason or something?)  Anyway, I told him I could tell the difference between shitty vodka and good vodka.  In a mixed drink.  He didn't believe me, so we did a taste test.  I was too cocky, and I guessed too quickly... he seemed very tickled that I was wrong.  On the other hand, he had still bought me two drinks.  Who's the sucker now, huh?

So, Steff's is kind of a crappy cave, which is unfortunate, given its location.  When I worked near there, I would've loved to have some better options for happy hours.  It was either schmooze with the rich d-bags in the overpriced restaurants or hob-nob with um... rich d-bags in the dives.  

Also, there were people at the bar doing shots, and they kept buying shots for us too.  This fueled our bar exam talk (we knew we shouldn't, but we just couldn't help ourselves).  That performance test was ridiculous, wasn't it?  What the hell is putative marriage?  

Aw, Christ... they bought us another shot.
author: Alissa K.

description: Great sports bar. Cheap drinks. Pleasant bartender.
author: Jeanette M.

description: My friends and i went in last week for my birthday. The atmosphere was great, but that changed shortly after the rude, plus sized, bi-polar Asian bartender gave attitude, when we asked for more drinks.  They shouldn't hire bartenders who are not friendly, and/or are bi-polar. That totally brought down the "high". We will definitely not be returning there. With an attitude like that, more and more people will not return.  By her being plus sized and unattractive, she could definitely use some d1ck to make her happy. Trust me, I'm a female, I know. Good luck with that!
author: Bo J.

description: This is our go to spot for a lunchtime HH. Sometimes when work is stressful and coworkers are crabby a drink does a mind good. Cool bartenders, affordable drinks, big TV and jukebox, what more could you ask for. I'll keep coming back til the wheels fall off.
author: Bj S.

description:
I don't go to watch sports.  I go to drink.  And drink I do. The bartenders are always very attentive and friendly.  Great place to have too many drinks and not care what you do or say.

Terri is frickin awesome.
author: Meg W.

description:
The Good:
-Never too crowded
-Casual
-POOL TABLE IN THE BACK
-Free popcorn
-Jukebox
-Close to my work
-Dive bar

The Bad:
-Dive bar
-Beers are $5 even though it's a dive
-Sports always on TV
-Bartenders lack charisma
-If no one puts money in the jukebox, there's no music
-Bathroom stall consists of a curtain

The Ugly:
-Pretty much everyone in the joint.


Not the perfect bar, but it's nearby and serves as an excellent place to play a game of pool and drink a beer or two.  I've always had a good time there... it's a chill place to pre-game on a Friday night or blow off some steam after work.
author: Mari C.

description:
Came here for happy hour after work.  Perhaps it was the 98% oj in the screwdriver I ordered or maybe it was the the rowdy and obnoxious gang of dudes that walked in to the girls bathroom asking my friends and I if we want to do "a couple lines" (yes blow at 5:00 on a Wednesday) that made this place happy hour one of the worst happy hours I've experienced downtown.  Yeah - they have a huge projector screen for the games but I will NEVER go here again.  

Steff - You should really pay attention to the crowd you attract.  I'm pretty sure its not appropriate for men with bags of blow to be walking in on girls in the bathroom. Even after we politely turned them down and gently shoved them out of the bathroom, they continued to pop in.

Drinks ( practically non-alcholic) +crowd ( loud, rude, cokeheads) = 1 star.  I guess the one star is for the popcorn...
author: Cassie B.

description: Pretty awesome place.. kinda empty-ish on a saturday night, which was nice as I had to lot of catching up to do with the friends I went there with. Good drinks, clean bathrooms and lots of TVs all around playing different sports matches!
author: Aditya M.

description:
Very large beers...very small darts.
Cheap corndogs, fun environment, I'd go back....to be honest we went at the end of the night so we don't remember much...but what we do remember...we liked.
author: Michael W.

description:
A good lunch spot in the FiDi, especially through the summer. The hand-made grilled sandwiches are tasty and reasonably priced. Quite a bit of light comes in through the front windows, so the place never feels like a cave. A rack of 8 TV's hangs over the bars, typically showing 3 sports channels at once. Several other TV's are scattered throughout the bar, so you're never out of view.

The bartenders are generally quick, friendly, HOT, and perfectly willing to locate your favorite game on TV if it's not super-busy. I like to come here for lunch during baseball season and watch a few innings over a sandwich and a frosty beverage. The rest of the year, there's not much on the tube to hold my attention, but they're always busy in the evening for basketball games.

Trivia: According to a 2004 US Bureau of Labor Statistics study, Montana is the only state wherein more than 1% of the population is employed as bartenders. Who wants to road-trip with me?
author: Bill B.

description: Granted this place is small and simple (your usual sports bar), but the owner, Stephanie is great!  My friends and I have rented this place out on several occasions for birthday parties and New Year's Eve parties.  The bar staff is friendly and attentive.  And with the small rental fee and reasonable bar tab, you practically get this place rent free!  Perfect for small and private parties .... you bring your own DJ and food.  We'll definitely be back!  Don't forget to ask for Stephanie!!!
author: elaine i.
