description: I love this bar, it will forever be my Cheers. The bartenders are friendly, drinks are cheap and strong, juke box and a pool table in the back. This is in my opinion a perfect bar, I have my birthdays here every single year and its a great place to go to just to grab a drink after a long day at work or kicking back and relaxing over the weekend. Definitely recommend this bar to everyone.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
A great dive-y place by work. It's a spot some peeps at work like to frequent. It is easy to pop in for a drink, catch part of some sporting event and then head to public transportation. I've had some fun here and a couple irish car bombs. It started out with...
V: Hey B, let's have a car bomb
B: Nooooooo
V: Oh, come on. Don't be a wuss.
B: *reluctantly agrees*
Soon, after we a bunch of people wanting in on the car bomb and next thing you know...we have about 20+ people doing an irish car bomb together. Now, that's T-I-G-H-T!
author: Vanessa W.

description:
If I'm bored with something I tend to forget it.  I've been in plenty of bad conversations where all the person does it talk about themselves, their job, their 10 best friends and how they went to a nail salon last week and got the best manicures and how they met this guy in a bar who was a sleaze and all he wanted was sex and how they love carrying their teacup chihuahua around and the owner of a meat market kicked them out because no pets were allowed there and how could the guy do that because after all I live in the Marina ... 

ok you get it, I hope.

Boredom in Steff's Bar's case gets 3 stars.  There is nothing at all special about the bar except maybe the $1.50 corndog which can torpedo through your body faster than a speeding bullet.  The place is dirty, the pool table probably has been used after hours for activities I don't want to know about, the beer is still $5 all the time, there is no music (unless someone ponies up money for the jukebox) and the general crowd is eh.  

Why 3 stars?  Cause I like dive bars.  This place serves beer.  Sports screeens litter the bar.  And you won't find people described in the first paragraph here.
author: Bill P.

description: When visiting San Fran, it took me FOREVER to find a place to watch some sports on a Saturday. Once I found Steff's, I was good to go. Cheap drinks and lots of T.V.s playing everything I wanted to see. Honestly...what more could you ask for in a sports bar? Yeah, there was no food, but who needs to eat when you can down massive amounts of beer and not go completely broke? I'm a fan of this place.
author: Kaity J.

description:
Came here after stupid Harlot wouldn't let our part in! WHATEVER

The bar was pretty empty and silent when we came in with our party of 20-25 or so. We weren't sure what to expect and were about to call it a night. But we turned on the juke box that was connected to the internet and ordered some bottles and went all the way into the back where there was a pool table to accommadate our party. After the music started it was a pretty cool place. The bar was clean and they have tvs seeing as its a sports bar. It got pretty crowded after 1130pm. I would come back here on a regular night maybe and enjoy some sports and a beer.
author: Jazmine S.

description:
Free popcorn + cold beer + lot's of flat screen TV's = a great spot to watch  Arizona get mauled for March Madness.  

It got a little crowded but the staff was friendly and efficient.  $10 minimum for a credit card.  Corn dogs for $2.  hot dogs for $2.75.  Popcorn free.

Auf.
author: Dave K.

description:
3.50 stars.

Pretty nice sports bar. They have the flat and clear HDTVs and two projectors on the side. The place is fairly large (it's wide, unlike other bars which are narrow). The drinks selection is good, and the price is decent. They also have their own popcorn making machine in the back, and you can grab it yourselves. After a few baskets, you'll probably be thirsty for more drinks!

I like this place, and I would come back.
author: Sam W.

description: Pretty much indistinguishable from any other bar in SF.  A fine place to pass the time and watch a game or something.
author: Christopher R.

description: Steff's is my favorite sports bar in San Francisco.  Very nice bar tenders, reasonable prices,, friendly atmosphere, hdtv's everywhere.  My idea of heaven having Steff or Terry serving me drinks with a great game on.
author: John L.

description: I started going to Steff's during this past baseball season because my boyfriend's roommate and his sister loved to meet here to watch the games. I actually thought it was a great place to enjoy the Giants game! The drinks are reasonable and the environment is super fun. It can be hard to get the bartender's attention when it gets packed and I noticed only one bartender is working each time I have come here, which seems unreasonable considering how many people flood in to watch the game. I can't wait to start watching the game at Steff's this season!
author: Surge C.

description:
Steff's is a great no-nonsense place to get a drink with a friend or fifteen (there have been more than a few occasions when my coworkers and I have pretty much taken over the entire bar... sorry, everyone else).  If you're just going with a small group, you can actually hear each other talk without the yelling and spitting into one's ear.  The bartenders are quick and friendly and there's *free popcorn.*  Cheap corndogs are great for an after-work snack while drinking, too.  

The only downside is that every so often, there's a crowd of weirdos standing outside chain-smoking, trying to mack on your female friends... in a creepy way.  Like, "hey, pretend you're my boyfriend so that creepy guy stops talking to me" creepy.
author: Gary L.

description: Whu' happen??  Free popcorn. Lakers playoffs.  My friends kept buying be expensive shots of Japanese whiskey.
author: erik w.

description:
This little diver gets 3 stars from me.
1 for the popcorn
1 for the pool table
1 for putting on the Yankee game for me 
1 for being so close to the office
-1 for being too close to the office
= 3 (see)
author: matt l.

description:
Warriors 130 - Spurs 121 in OT.

Nuff' Said. If the Warriors had lost this review may have much fewer stars.

The bartender was nice/sassy and had a funny habit of playing random music to pair w/ the intensity of the game....cold beers, plenty of screens.
We were in the area and needed a Sports Bar stat to finish the Dubs game and Steff's fit the bill. Thanks Steff's.
VOTE Obama/ Baron aka Boom Dizzle '08!!!!!!
author: Gabe b.

description: Pretty decent place to hang out. I went with a group from work and we played pool and worked the jukebox. Lame sound system though.
author: David W.

description:
This place is far from fancy, but if you can't get into anywhere else in the area (Asian American film festival opening weekend and private parties going on everywhere) and you're just looking to have a drink or two (or three), this place has very cheap drinks - the cheapest drinks in the area! 

They have a pool table, tvs, and a digital juke box. If you're hungry, they serve hotdogs and corndogs all day, but I wouldn't dare try one. This place isn't exactly the most sanitary.
author: Melissa P.

description:
It's March Madness time, which means only one thing: any place that has the game on and serves food is an acceptable lunch destination.  One of my coworkers convinced me to join him at Steff's promising $5 lunch specials and non-stop basketball action.

We showed up at Steff's before the lunch crowd, right around 11:40 am.  We had no problem finding a table, but if we had arrived at noon, we would have had to stand by the bar.  

My coworker wasn't lying.  Old, old 20'' screen TVs showed all 4 games in amazing Lo-Def.  Paper signs crudely taped to the bottom of the TV stand indicated which game was on.  The $7 lunch special included an Irish style corned beef and cabbage sandwich with a soda.  It took us about 15 minutes to get our sandwiches, because apparently the sandwiches are brought . . . from the sandwich place next door!  The sandwich was surprisingly decent and even somewhat warm!

The crowd was interesting: mostly cheap businessmen in suits and loud construction workers in dirty overalls.  Not my kind of place, but like I said, all is fair in "Love and Basketball."

The highlight of our lunch was an unexpected visit by . . . Sal Castaneda of KTVU Channel 2.  He did a couple of interviews, although he never asked for my opinion.  I watch Sal every morning and even see him at PacBell from time to time, but I have to say this: when it comes to his French cologne, the rule of thumb is "less is more!"

I'll probably go back to Steff's, maybe even tomorrow.
author: Yan G.

description:
The only that that stops me from giving this place five stars in the occasionally assy crowd that haunts this place on Friday nights. Otherwise, this is by far the best place to go catch a pint or two after work if you're part of the SOMA crowd. No financial district/marina types here scouting for their latest conquest, just a bunch of honest people looking to blow off some steam after work. The beers are cheap and plentiful, mixed drinks are just the right amount of stiff, and the bartenders are super friendly, and always seem to be getting your favorite drink ready for you the moment you step in the door. This is also a great place to catch a pre-Giants game buzz if you don't feel like taking the N all the way to the ballpark.

If you're a single woman, you might want to steet clear of this place on Friday nights, unless being ogled and groped at the front door by drunken electricians is your thing.
author: Tim T.

description:
Been there several times. As a sports bar which is what it is meant to be there is really nothing more you can ask of it except bigger TV's. Drinks are well priced about average compared to other sport bars. 

I have attended some private party's here also and found the place adequate. enough room for a DJ and a small dance floor.

That pretty much sums it up. Good place to hit for a game or for some after work drinks.
author: Alfredo N.

description:
I enjoy this place. But I mostly drink during the middle of the day so there are only about six of us serious alcoholics in there, and me and my two friends make up the only females. I like the bartenders and they know who I am. The beer is cold, and cheaper than pretty much everywhere else around here. When I have had a drink here during regular hours the clientele can be  little sketchy.

Here's the only thing that truly bothers me: Why can't the owner install a dishwasher? Would it be prohibitively expensive? I can't stand watching the poor bartender girls scrub glasses with yellow gloves, put the glasses out to dry, and then have to take them off to pour me another beer. And they always seem to be short on glasses. Maybe I'll start picking a bottled option.
author: Lisa M.

description:
I personally loved it. But I love divey places. They had some big TVs. But I didn't care about that. I met some pretty cool people there. I'd definitely go back again. 

Having a Jukebox is probably the best thing ever. 

Its also the type of place you can go if you just wanna chat with friends. I've been in there some nights and there was virtually nobody in there. I guess thats what happens when you go out at night in that part of SOMA.
author: Roderic C.

description:
Besides the fact that a friend of mine works the bar...i truly enjoyed being here.  The bar was loud, a little grungey and perfect for just chilln' out and having a beer, or a cocktail or 2...The crowd was a total eclectic mix, there were the yuppies, the hippies, the frat boys and the suits. It was great. There's a pool table in the back, perfect for meeting cool peeps, and the bathroom wasn't dirty. A+. 

This will definitely become a local joint for me..(bartender) Jeff is awesome! Go on Thursday nights and get him drunk!! it'll be worth the price of your drinks!~
author: Lulu C.

description:
I go to watch sports during the work week.  Good place to catch soccer matches and the sandwiches they make are surprisingly tasty, it's got to be the jalapenos.  
I don't see any other reason to go here besides to watch sports.
author: Jon P.

description:
Not a bad choice for a bar to catch a game, interesting antiquated bikes adorn the ceiling, but seem precariously hung, is this up to code? After a couple of drinks, i forgot all about it.

The tenders of the bar are quick and agile. This is not a 'dive' bar, as i have read in some of these posts, what dive bar dishes out complimentary appetizers? This only happens on happy hour however.
author: wayne s.

description: Maybe it's because it's a sports bar.  I've never been a big sport's bar fan.  If sports bars and good beers went together, maybe.  But, invariably, the more TV's a place has the weaker and more pisswater the beer seems to get.  This place had quite a few televisions.
author: Mason G.

description:
Steff's is slightly dive-y. So right there, they get a few stars from me. 

I worked for several years in this area so I've been to Steff's a lot, mostly after work to blot out the fact that I was working wherever I was by Steff's. They always have every game imaginable on the multiple TV screens, with free popcorn to boot. Bottled and draft beer is reasonably priced, so you can get liquored up pronto after a rough 8 hours slaving for The Man. 

It's also very close to Montgomery BART and about 20 MUNI lines on Market St., so it's perfect for commuters who need a ride home after tanking up. I usually hit Steff's right after work for a few dozen cold ones when I'm heading out on BART to yet another leftover show at Concord Pavillion, like Poison or Def Leppard. 

Two caveats- this place is JAMMED with Giants fans on game days, getting liquored up right before the game (Giants ballpark is about 6 blocks down, and Steff's is perhaps the last stop for beers under $7). It's not horrible, just look at the Giants schedule before you go and know there might be a lot of folks there whooping it up, and you'll be guranteed to hear someone called "bra" about 50 times. 

The service can be spotty as well- spacy bartenders have served me the wrong drink on several occasions and shortchanged me too.
author: Steve M.

description:
Why is a "sports bar" not open on Saturday?  That is crazy!

Two college football Saturdays lost...
author: Mackenzie O.

description: Pretty standard bar. They do allow you to bring in food from wherever. Drinks are affordable, plenty of TVs showing sports. Pool table, free popcorn. Close to work (financial district).
author: vishal k.

description: came here on a friday night after a giant's game.  the bartenders are extremely helpful and friendly, and they have tons of tv's with all different games on.  even though it was a little crowded and busy, i was still served promptly.  being a bartender myself, i can appreciate how hardworking the staff here is.  the prices are really decent, considering it's the financial district, and they have snacks as well.
author: asia c.

description: Went to watch a 'Cuse vs. UConn bball game and I had a good time.  By no means is this a dive bar, as described in some reviews.  The beer prices were fair, tv's were big (wished for better placement), and free popcorn is never a bad deal when drinking.
author: LIVE to E.

description: When walking down the row of FiDi douchebag bar choices this doesn't stand out in any way. I don't know if that's good or bad.  It just leaves me feeling solidly meh about it. It's next door to Eddie Rickenbacker's so that's the only distinguishing feature about it.  My whiskey sour was okay but it kind of took a little too long to get to me as did the drinks of my other companions.  In the time I could have had two drinks I only was able to consume one.  This left me in significant pain later when my companions and I walked to Polk and Sutter from here and my high heeled ass wasn't buzzed enough to not notice the distance being traveled in my Michael Kors.  The odd choice of offering corn dogs and hot dogs a la 7-11 is a strange touch as well.  My final synopsis is that this is just one more place I'd never been to and am not likely to return to.
author: Jill D.

description: A pool table, darts, and an internet jukebox... then there is a cute bartender who's showing a tad bit more cleavage than a prostitute on E. 14th.  This place is more like a dive bar.  Drinks aren't too bad and aren't too expensive.  Still i was bored... its not very lively there and watching my friends get completely wasted and acting like fools isn't always my idea of fun.  Not excited about going back.  I think that says a lot!
author: Aaron G.

description: My rating didn't change. I gave this place another shot (against my will). Aforementioned hot dogs and corn dogs were nowhere to be found beyond the writing on the small dry erase board behind the register. The menu is obsolete. Apparently there is popcorn but upon close inspection of the popcorn popper, the last few lonely kernels were completely unappetizing. I was starved and getting too drunk too soon on bad wine. Oh, and speaking of the wine, when I asked what kind they had, I got a confused look, convoluted answer (white something or maybe red?), and the last glass of chilled white wine. Regardless, I won't be back.
author: Angela N.

description: Steff's is a mellow bar I like to frequent for the Carlsberg beer on tap and cool staff. Very much a neighborhood kinda bar with plenty of regular faces even though it is located downtown. Will be heading there in 15 min and counting;)
author: David H.

description: Yay for cheap corn dogs, even though they are microwaved in front of you.
author: Jeanne C.

description: This place always gives me the creeps. Usually a douche-filled crowd and the bartenders all seem a little too skanky (think Hooters but not quite as classy). Plus, for a sports bar, they've got pretty old, small TVs.
author: Andrew L.

description: I'm giving them 2 stars because they have a Internet jukebox, and the pool table is always available. They make so-so drinks for a so-so price. Probably, you just want to order a beer, that can't go wrong! This is a place for old farts.
author: Jelly G.

description: A good watering hole while watching KG taking it to the hole or before heading over to Minna. They also have one of the friendliest bartenders in the city working: Yoga Jeff making liquor magic. Just don't answer his "What will you have?" with "I leave it up to you." because he takes that very seriously. Within minutes I had several options, from what he called a "Manly-Man drink," an ultra clear concoction which hit me harder than one of Tyson's mule punches, and another concoction that looked like a fruit parfait....also hit like a Piano dropping on your head.  Good after work option especially if you travel in packs. After my experience with Yoga Jeff: know before you go!!!
author: Johnny C.

description: As far as sports bars go, Steff's is solid. It's got tons of TVs, usually lots of seating, free popcorn and lots of beer. What more do you want? Oh and there's free popcorn (it warrants two mentions) and a pool table and they let you bring in food from other spots and eat it in the bar.
author: Cathy T.

description: The Best Sports Bar. I have been waiting for Football all year and now that it's here only one Bar in all of the Bay area has the biggest True HDTV I have ever seen inside a bar. Actually, they have two located at each end of the bar and many flat screens in-between. All in HD but, really, the Big Sreens are amazing. Monday Night Football will never be the same in SF...
author: Elliott B.

description: Not too crowded, not too empty, and it has that Erotic Photo hunt....sweeeeet
author: Erik T.

description: Like a neighborhood spot right down the street from the office. Pool. Darts. Beer. Nothing super special but it can feel good to go somewhere this chill after a long day of work.
author: Amy K.

description: Good sports bar.  Nice place to watch a game while having a few drinks with friends.
author: Luis M.

description: Total dive bar.  Half the tvs were broken, and others had on duplicate games.  When we asked the bartender to put on a play-offs hockey game on one tv she said she couldn't because it was broken (turns out she just didn't know how).  After all this complaining, you're probably wondering why I am giving them 3 stars?  Alcohol makes it all better....  They also serve cheap hot dogs, corn dogs and chips...eat at your own risk!  I saw the bartender pull out a corn dog from a container under the bar (not sure if there was a cooler under there) and popped it in the microwave for a few.  No one in our group dared to try them, but we saw many people in the bar try their luck.  An extra star, and a BIG thank you to the bartender with the accent, who said "I hate you" after she carded me and saw how old I was. :)
author: San D.

description: This place is rad sauce. The crowd is mixed and friendly. If you're a bit anti-social go during the day. The bartenders are cool and the beer is cold. COLD- Just to emphasize to the ones who know the importance. If you're into sports this is the place to go, cause they have a buttload of plasmas, and if you ask the bartender nicely they will change it to the game you need.  The bathrooms aren't scary and there's plenty of seating. OH and btw  beer and liquor is CHEAPER here. Beer at the most is 5 bux and makers is 7. Temple made me pay 10. Nuff said.
author: malarky j.

description: I watched the World Series here and followed a bunch of ballgames over the course of the season as well, usually after work. The bartender has always been cool about switching to a game you actually care about; this is sweet because I don't have MLB extra innings at home. Bar patrons tend to be a random assortment of 9-5 types, with a few regulars. Everyone tends to mind their own business so this is a good happy hour stop--to watch sports. The unfortunate part though, is that they have no happy hour specials to speak of. Beer isn't the cheapest in town but if you're only having a couple on your way elsewhere, it's not too bad. Also, if you smoke, you'll never miss anything because you can monitor the game from outside, either from the big projector screen or else from one of the 4 or 5 stacked TVs in the entryway. Geez, this was a totally serious review.
author: Jenn W.

description: I came into Steff's on a friday night and the place was pretty empty. I didn't mind as my friend and I were pretty unenthusiastic about the night that pre-empted Steff's so we sat at the bar and played liar's dice. We were there for a little bit over an hour and had an ok tim. I was a bit worried when the drunk guy next to me started tripping over the stools and hitting the bar, nearly knocking over 2 pints of beer that were right next to me. Also the washing method of the glasses that doesn't include a dishwasher is a no no for me. This is definitely a dive bar, sports bar maybe, and a good place to get semi cheap drinks at the end of the night.
author: D J.

description: Steff's smells like a mix between fresh urine and stale popcorn. Don't order any of the food because it will make you sick. It's not a bad place to watch a game and they do have an internet jukebox which is nice. There is also a pool table in the back. Personally I love the place but I do understand why others dislike it. It's a nice dive type sport bar. In fact if I was a bar I think I'd look like Steff's
author: kArlos A.

description: I head 2 this joint once a year 4 Rube's annual bday bash...My boy Rube does this spot every year since I've been back N Cali...Its a cool lil spot...Drinks R decent & when U catchin up wit frenz, U can't really hate on the spot...
author: Diem L.

description: This is the local watering hole for people working at GameSpot down on 2nd street.  The bartenders are friendly, there are lots of TV's, there is a Jukebox and pool table.  Downsides are the floor gets sticky, the bathrooms are disgusting and as of late there have been some real rowdy people hanging out in there.  Still, you can find me there a few nights a week hanging out with my compadres.
author: Pele N.

description: A perfect stop on a pub crawl or any night out for an unpretentious drink and a chance to converse with friends. Slightly quieter than other neighborhood venues but a perfect stop while you wait for some of the clubs in the area to open. Stefanie is friendly and accommodating and worked with me to sort out stopping here on our massive bar crawl. The staff were open and non-judgemental. Perfect for our night out.
author: Jessica M.

description: Seems like a decent place but on the night we went, there was a rough crowd and the bartender (Asian guy) seemed more focused on drinking beer instead of serving it.  One drunk guy at the bar starting yelling at a young female tourist and she left.  Not a safe place for out of towners.
author: Tom F.

description: Dropped by here one night and found this place to be really fun.   I personally love long big bars and Steff's has that.  It has a small dance floor and played typical sports white man fist pumping music.  Love it.  Cant really say much besides its like any other sports bar you can visualize and imagine to be
author: Charles C.

description: hot asian bartenders that's a real plus!  i'm only giving this place two stars because they are not open on sunday's.  what kind of sports bar are you, if you are not open for football?  the prices aren't bad.  a coors and shot of hornitos was $9.50.  the pours are not big.  it's mostly a place to watch a game after work and drink a cheap beer.  nothing more.  steffs takes plastic which is a plus, since most downtown bars do not.
author: T D.

description: I spend too much time in this spot, but I must say Teri is above and beyond the best bartender in the joint.  Fridays are cool if your enjoy washing dishes, for those who know.  The hard hats tend to take over and blow out the bathrooms, see previous reviews for clarification.  It could be a dope little dive spot, but it is what it is...
author: Aaron G.

description: This bar has absolutely nothing to offer. I would give it negative stars if I could.
author: Guillaume J.

description: This is the quintessential dive/sports bar.  Pool table in the back, dozens of TVs and Lot's of fun.  Jeff, Steff, Nancy and the rest of the bar crew are all awesome!
author: Kevin D.

description: small divey place right next door to eddie rickenbakers.... this is a typical hole in the wall sports bar. nothing too exciting, but nothing terrible either. i always walk by and see the exact same guy standing out front smoking a cigarette and talking on his cell phone.(yikes, talk about being a regular) inside there's usually a small crowd with their beers clutched in hand as they stare like zombies at the TV. last time i was there, i went in and only stayed for 15 minutes... not because i didn't like it, but i just prefer having more a crowd when i'm watching sports. its not a bad little bar, but if i'm in the area i prefer going to katie o'briens around the corner instead.
author: Michelle I.

description: so i dont really yelp about sport bars...but this is a cool spot....yeah theres no food service/menu~but the big screen tv's make up for it~theres like about 8 wit a pool hall in the back~went last week for the march madness shindig....we got there early~b4 u kno it tha place was packed/crowded~yeah it was march madness & round happy hr time...if u get tooo loaded....grab sum osha/thai food next door or hit up the taco joint up the street.....
author: elmer d.

description: I like coming here just to have a drink and talk to friends.  Watch a game on their big screen HD tv's.  Cheap drinks.  Happy Hour's even better.  No dress code.  Great dive bar near the Financial district so it's convenient to drop by after work.
author: Mich C.

description: i hesitated to write this review for a while now.....its in a good location and they got the games on always, bartenders are hella nice and so you'd think it'd get a good rating, but i never could give it one before bc those tvs were just way too old to be calling it a sports bar....well that changed and they got plasmas now so i can give it a good rating that it deserves...this place is pretty chill to catch the game, particularly after work or school as it is right by financial and golden gate university. They dont really have food but don't seem to trip if u bring some in...good selection of drinks and not over priced...overall a cool spot
author: Vishal M.

description: beer and tv....or beer and karaoke either are good as long as I can ride BART to and fro!
author: N. C.
